data.title: Newsom halts California death penalty. Here are Riverside County's 90 death row inmates
authors: Sam Metz, Christopher Damien and Colin Atagi, The Desert Sun
data.meta_description: Riverside County has one of the highest rates of death row inmates in California.
data.text:
California Gov. Gavin Newsom announced a moratorium on the death penalty in California, granting stays of execution to the state’s 737 death row inmates, closing the death chamber at San Quentin State Prison and repealing the state’s lethal injection protocol.

In an executive order, Newsom called capital punishment both costly and discriminatory.

“Death sentences are unevenly and unfairly applied to people of color, people with mental disabilities, and people who cannot afford costly legal representation,” he wrote. “Since 1978, California has spent $5 billion on a death penalty system that has executed 13 people.”

The California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation lists 90 condemned inmates in the department's death row tracking system who were adjudicated in Riverside County. That figure puts Riverside County's death penalty adjudication rate per 100,000 residents above all other California counties with more than 200,000 residents.

More: Judge denies the appeal of death penalty decision for accused cop killer John Hernandez Felix

More: Death penalty an option for John Hernandez Felix in Palm Springs police murder trial

California has not executed any death row inmates since 2006. Newsom has long opposed capital punishment but in recent elections, California voters have struck down both a proposition to abolish the death penalty and approved a proposition to expedite the process.

“Our death penalty system has been – by any measure – a failure,” Newsom said at a press conference on Wednesday morning. “It has provided no public safety benefit or value as a deterrent … But most of all, the death penalty is absolute. Irreversible and irreparable in the event of human error.”

In response to the announcement, State Sen. Jeff Stone, R-La Quinta, questioned the legality of circumventing the courts and issuing a blanket moratorium and said it ignored the beliefs of most Californians.

“Once again, the voices of the citizens of this state are again ignored and the consequences of crime are further diminished,” he said.

Stone, in a statement published on his Facebook page, said the moratorium is unfair to victims of murder. He referenced death row inmates and others murders he believes merit the death penalty, including the 2016 murder of Palm Springs police officers Gil Vega and Lesley Zerebny.

Analysis: Gov. Gavin Newsom takes a big stand on the death penalty. Will it cost him?

“This news cannot be welcomed by the victims’ families,” he said about Zerebny and Vega.

Newsom acknowledged support of the death penalty within victims' rights groups, but said it doesn't justify upholding the system.

"To the victims, all I can say is, we owe you and we need to do more and do better, more broadly for victims in this state … but we cannot advance the death penalty in an effort to try to soften the blow of what happened," he said.

He said he is uncomfortable with the scope of death row in California, which has twice as many death row inmates as Florida, the state with the second-largest death row.

"We are considering executing more people than any other state in modern history — to line up human beings, every day, for executions for two-plus years," he said.

Riverside County Public Defender Steve Harmon said he was pleased to hear of Newsom's executive order.

"The death penalty has forever been morally wrong and too often unfairly imposed and I'm thankful to the governor for his courage to do the right thing," Harmon said. "I continue to hope the death penalty will one day soon be abolished completely."

Condemned inmates adjudicated in Riverside County:

Here's a compilation of death row inmates who were convicted in Riverside County, as reported by the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation, as of March 12, 2019, with synopses from various media outlets. This list will be updated.

• Roman Aldana, 31, offense date: Sept. 9, 2006, sentenced: July 30, 2010

Aldana ordered the death of a teenage runaway he and two others had sex with in an abandoned building before they tortured her. She was stabbed and left behind in the building after it was set on fire.

• James Anderson, 66, offense date: March 04, 1979, sentenced: Nov. 30, 1979

Anderson was convicted in Indio Superior Court of two counts of murder for strangling two women in a Coachella citrus grove after they had car trouble off of Interstate 10.

• Joseph Avila, 49, offense date: Jan. 12, 1991, sentenced: April 29, 1999

Avila was convicted of two counts of murder for stabbing deaths of two men in a Riverside parking lot.

• Michael Barbar, 61, offense date: Nov. 14, 2009, sentenced: Dec. 14, 2012

Barbar was convicted of killing his wife and her daughter in revenge for his wife's extramarital affair.

• Raymond Barrera, 28, offense date: July 8, 2013, sentenced: Dec. 1, 2017

Barrera was convicted of three murders that happened near San Jacinto from 2013.

• Richard Booker, 41, offense date: Aug. 10, 1995, sentenced: Nov. 22, 1999

Booker was convicted for killing two girls and a woman in a Riverside apartment.

• Michael Bramit, 42, offense date: June 14, 1994, sentenced: Sept. 8, 1997

Gramit was convicted of first-degree murder after fatally shooting a man in Banning while robbing him.

• Andrew Brown, 49, offense date: Nov. 11, 1988, sentenced: May 14, 1992

Brown was convicted of first-degree murder and robbery for shooting a woman in Perris while trying to steal the rims off of her truck.

• Albert Brown, 64, offense date: Oct. 28, 1980, sentenced: Feb. 22, 1982

Brown was convicted of first-degree murder with the special circumstance of murder committed during the course of rape. The victim was a 14-year-old girl killed at her home in Riverside. Brown was scheduled to be executed in Sept. 2010, but the order was delayed after a last-minute reprieve by Gov. Schwarzenegger.

• Dora Buenrostro, 58, offense date: Oct. 27, 1994, sentenced: Oct. 2, 1998

Buenrostro convicted of first-degree murder of her three children — ages 9, 8, and 4 — at their apartment in San Jacinto. Buenrostro told police her estranged husband had committed the murders.

• Jeffree Buettner, 43, offense date: May 28, 2002, sentenced: April 23, 2010

Buettner killed Stephanie Ann Benton in May 2002 after tying her up and putting her in a car trunk. She was strangled near Lake Elsinore. A co-defendant was Glen Joseph Jones.

• Michael Burgener, 68, offense date: Oct. 31, 1980, sentenced: Sept. 4, 1981

Burgener was convicted of murdering a man while robbing a convenience store in Riverside.

• Micky Cage, 50, offense date: Nov. 9, 1998, sentenced: Nov. 14, 2003

Cage was convicted of murdering his estranged wife's mother and brother in Moreno Valley.

• Robert Castro, 40, offense date: May 18, 2008, sentenced: Feb. 27, 2014

Castro was convicted of murder for the shooting death of a man in front of a home in Moreno Valley and the murder of a man in Fontana.

• Daniel Cervantes, 41, offense date: May 6, 2008, sentenced: Oct. 28, 2013

Cervantes was convicted of killing a 55-year-old Indio man, Daniel Kuzawa, during a carjacking, kidnapping and robbery. He was killed on Pierce Street in Thermal. Carlos Contreras was a co-defendant.

• Carlos Contreras, 40, offense date: April 28, 2008, sentenced: April 26, 2013

Contreras was convicted of killing a 55-year-old Indio man, Daniel Kuzawa, during a carjacking, kidnapping and robbery. He was killed on Pierce Street in Thermal. Daniel Cervantes was a co-defendant.

• David Contreras, 30, offense date: Dec. 29, 2012, sentenced: May 12, 2017

Contreras was convicted of three murders in Perris from 2012 and 2013.

• Michael Cook, 47, offense date: Jan. 24, 1998, sentenced: July 25, 2008

Cook was accused of killing two elderly women in Cathedral City. Florence Mash, 84, and Lucille Quigley, 86, died in fires that may have been started to hide burglaries at their homes.

• Juan Coronado Jr., 32, offense date: Jan. 28, 2008, sentenced: April 17, 2015

Coronado Jr. was convicted of beating and shooting 85-year-old Lupe Delgadillo during a robbery in Perris.

• Jackson Daniels, 80, offense date: May 13, 1982, sentenced: Jan. 31, 1984

Hart was convicted of shooting his ex-girlfriend, Brandi Morales, while her six children were present at her home in Moreno Valley in February 2011.

• Ronald Deere, 66, offense date: March 4, 1982, sentenced: Nov. 10, 1982

Deere was convicted of killing a man and his two daughters, ages 7 and 2, near Blythe. Deere was found days later hiding in the desert near where he worked as a farmhand.

• Gregory Demetrulias, 65, offense date: Jan. 10, 1989, sentenced: May 22, 1995

Demetrulias was convicted of murdering a man in Riverside during a robbery.

• Robert Dunson, 37, offense date: Nov. 26, 2007, sentenced: May 15, 2015

Dunson, who was convicted in March for the 2007 murder of William George Dobbs, an Indio snowbird. Dunson slashed Dobbs to death during a robbery, nearly decapitating him.

• Sonny Enraca, 46, offense date: Nov. 19, 1994, sentenced: July 23, 1999

Enraca was convicted of first-degree murder of two men and assaulting a woman with a deadly weapon during a gang fight that occurred after an illegal street race.

• Angel Esparza, 35, offense date: Dec. 30, 1899, sentenced: Feb. 20, 2015

Esparza killed Gregorio Juarez and Pedro Garcia in a Thermal vineyard at Avenue 58 and Pierce Street. Esparza had been on the run after shooting Angel Luna, 16, a month earlier in Coachella.

• Miguel Felix, 37, offense date: April 11, 2004, sentenced: May 26, 2015

Felix, who was convicted of killing Armand Gonzalez in Desert Hot Springs in 2004. Felix, a robber who targeted drug dealers, shot Gonzalez in his driveway in front of his wife and children.

• Eusebio Fierros, 29, offense date: Jan. 19, 2008, sentenced: May 18, 2012

Fierros was one of three defendants in the death of Lupe Delgadillo. The 85-year-old had been killed near Good Hope during a robbery and kidnapping. Another defendant was Juan Ramon Coronado.

• Marcus Fletcher, 35, offense date: April 1, 2005, sentenced: Nov. 18, 2011

Fletcher was convicted of murdering both a liquor store clerk during a robbery in Temecula and a man in San Diego County in a gang-related shooting.

• Jawaun Graham, 43, offense date: Jan. 22, 1966, sentenced: Jan. 13, 2012

Graham killed Manuel Gomez of Anaheim and Joel Rio-Sosa of Moreno Valley during a vehicle-to-vehicle shooting on Highway 91.

• Earl Green, 53, offense date: Nov. 7, 2010, sentenced: June 25, 2012

Green was convicted for the murder of a police officer during a chase that occured when the officer pulled Green over in Riverside.

• Jason Hann, 44, offense date: April 1, 2002, sentenced: March 27, 2014

Hann was convicted of murdering his two infant daughters, one in Desert Hot Springs and the other in Arkansas. Was granted name change in 2019 and is now Jessica Marie Hann.

• William Hart, 66, offense date: March 24, 1986, sentenced: May 27, 1988

Hart was convicted of murdering a minor and the rape, sodomy, and oral copulation of another after convincing them at 7-eleven to help him in a fake marijuana theft scheme.

• Tyrone Harts, 46, offense date: Feb. 22, 2011, sentenced: Jan. 30, 2015

Hart was convicted of shooting his ex-girlfriend, Brandi Morales, while her six children were present at her home in Moreno Valley in February 2011.

• Cisco Hartsch, 42, offense date: June 15, 1995, sentenced: Nov. 13, 1998

Hartsch was convicted of three counts of murder and shooting at an occupied dwelling for the shooting deaths of two people sleeping in a car in an orange grove and a minor.

• Paul Henderson, 49, offense date: Aug. 15, 1997, sentenced: May 25, 2001

Henderson was convicted of murdering a man and attempting to murder his wife during a robbery of their home.

• George Hernandez, 42, offense date: July 26, 2004, sentenced: Jan. 29, 2010

Hernandez was convicted of murdering a fellow member of the Mexiacn Mafia outside of a bar in Riverside.

• Lorraine Hunter, 63, offense date: Nov. 4, 2009, sentenced: Dec. 8, 2017

Hunter was convicted of a 2009 murder in Moreno Valley.

• Jonathan Jackson, 45, offense date: June 15, 1996, sentenced: Feb. 18, 2000

Jackson was convicted of first-degree murder in the shooting death of a woman and the attempted murder of a man during a home robbery in Mead Valley.

• Bailey Jackson, 47, offense date: May 15, 2001, sentenced: Nov. 8, 2005

Jackson kidnapped and killed an 81-year-old woman a month before raping an 84-year-old woman who survived after being left to die.

• Christopher Jasso, 46, offense date: Sept. 7, 2007, sentenced: Jan. 8, 2010

Jasso killed a cab driver in Indio during a robbery. He caught a cab and went to an area while an accomplice followed in a different car.

• Emrys John, 29, offense date: Oct. 15, 2008, sentenced: Aug. 16, 2013

John was one of three Marines who killed another Marine and his wife during a French Valley burglary, robbery and rape.The victims were Sgt. Jan Pietrzak and Quiana Jenkins-Pietrzak.

• Lumord Johnson, 54, offense date: June 25, 1994, sentenced: April 8, 2002

Johnson killed two people in Riverside and Mead Valley; Camerina Lopez and Martin Campos. They happened 17 months apart.

• Albert Jones, 54, offense date: Dec. 13, 1993, sentenced: Sept. 20, 1996

Jones was convicted of murdering a husband and wife in their home in Mead Valley during a robbery.

• William Jones, 62, offense date: June 18, 1996, sentenced: Feb. 8, 1999

Jones was convicted of first-degree murder and sexual assault of a neighbor in Mead Valley.

• Glen Jones, 35, offense date: May 28, 2002, sentenced: June 11, 2010

Jones killed Stephanie Ann Benton in May 2002 after tying her up and putting her in a car trunk. She was strangled near Lake Elsinore. A co-defendant was Jeffree Buettner.

• Kim Kopatz, 66, offense date: April 22, 1999, sentenced: March 21, 2001

Kopatz was convicted of killing his wife and 3-year-old daughter for insurance money.

• Phillian Lee, 41, offense date: Feb. 23, 1996, sentenced: July 9, 1999

Lee killed a 17-year-old Moreno Valley girl, Mele Calani Kekaula, who wouldn't have sex with him after they spent the night drinking and driving around.

• Jose Leon, 39, offense date: May 1, 2003, sentenced: May 12, 2006

Leon was accused of killing his ex-girlfriend's grandmother and 13-year-old brother out of revenge.

• Michael Lewis, 57, offense date: Aug. 2, 1991, sentenced: May 1, 1998

• Daniel Linton, 44, offense date: Nov. 29, 1994, sentenced: June 17, 1999

Linton killed a 12-year-old girl in San Jacinto. She stayed home from school and he found her after breaking into the home to steal money. She was strangled.

• Elias Lopez, 32, offense date: Oct. 10, 2004, sentenced: Jan. 13, 2017

Lopez was convicted of two homicides that occurred in Indio in October 2004. The victims were Erineo Perez and Martin Garcia and the killings were gang-related.

• Johnny Lopez, 39, offense date: Nov. 9, 2013, sentenced: Jan. 13, 2017

Lopez was convicted of two murders, a rape and attempted murder that happened in Hemet from 2013.

• Johnathan Luther, 38, offense date: Jan. 2, 2003, sentenced: April 27, 2007

Luther was convicted of killing a 74-year-old retired college professor who was shot while sitting in his home.

• Belinda Magana, 33, offense date: May 11, 2009, sentenced: May 1, 2015

Magana and her boyfriend Naresh Nadine, both of Corona, were convicted of abusing and killing Magana's 2-year-old son in 2009, then burying his body and pretending he went missing.

• Jesse Manzo, 31, offense date: May 2, 2008, sentenced: Aug. 12, 2013

Manzo was a gang member who killed Raymond Franklin, a Riverside father of four who was targeted because he was black.

• Romaine Martin, 44, offense date: May 27, 2011, sentenced: May 16, 2016

Martin was a gang member who ordered a shooting in Moreno Valley.

• Omar Martinez, 58, offense date: Nov. 4, 1988, sentenced: May 10, 1993

Martinez killed one of several men who demanded payment for work on his property. He drove up to them one night and opened fire, killing Victor Castillo.

• Crandell Mckinnon, 51, offense date: Jan. 4, 1994, sentenced: March 5, 1999

McKinnon was convicted of the first-degree murders of two men in Banning.

• Tyrone Miller, 31, offense date: October 15, 2008, sentenced: July 19, 2013

Miller was one of three Marines who killed another Marine and his wife during a French Valley burglary, robbery and rape.The victims were Sgt. Jan Pietrzak and Quiana Jenkins-Pietrzak.

• Donald Millwee, 66, offense date: September 06, 1986, sentenced: March 21, 1990

He was convicted of killing his mother, Esta Millwee, who was paralyzed on one side of her face after suffering a brain aneurysm in 1981. The shooting followed an argument Millwee had with his father over work.

• Joseph Montes, 45, offense date: August 27, 1994, sentenced: March 18, 1997

Montes was convicted of first-degree murder, kidnapping, and carjacking

• Johnny Mungia, 62, offense date: April 12, 1994, sentenced: April 07, 1997

The killing happened during a robbery. The victim was Alma Franklin, a 73-year-old who lived next door to the defendant's sister.

• Naresh Narine, 46, offense date: May 11, 2009, sentenced: May 01, 2015

Nadine and his girlfriend, Belinda Magana, both of Corona, were convicted of abusing and killing Magana's 2-year-old son in 2009, then burying his body and pretending he went missing.

• Raymond Oyler, 48, offense date: May 16, 2006, sentenced: June 05, 2009

Oyler was convicted of starting the 2006 Esperanza Wildfire, which killed five U.S. Forest Service firefighters. The fire burned 41,000 acres.

• Jesus Penuelas, 36, offense date: August 15, 2003, sentenced: August 08, 2008

Penuelas was accused of killing an 18-year-old Ontario woman following a robbery. She was beat unconscious and locked in a car trunk naked while driven to Rubidoux, where Penuelas ran over her body several times.

• Christopher Poore, 49, offense date: Nov. 8, 1999, sentenced: Feb. 20, 2002

Poore killed Mark Kulikov, 42, of Palm Springs. He was shot five times while sitting in a chair in his bedroom. The killing involved a robbery.

• David Reed, 59, offense date: March 9, 2004, sentenced: Oct. 31, 2011

Reed killed Ricky Mosley, a black transient. Reed claimed he waited two weeks outside a Palm Springs restaurant for a man who sexually assaulted his wife but also made comments indicating the killing may have been racially motivated.

• Billy Riggs, 72, offense date: April 16, 1990, sentenced: Oct. 28, 1994

Riggs was convicted of murdering a woman in Indio as he and his wife stole her car, which they sold days later in Fresno.

• Orlando Romero, 47, offense date: Oct. 12, 1992, sentenced: Aug. 28, 1996

Romero committed a crime spree that involved the deaths of at least three people. His brother, Christopher Self, also was involved in the series of events that lasted three months at the end of 1992.

• Brooke Rottiers, 39, offense date: Aug. 28, 2006, sentenced: Oct. 22, 2010

Rottiers of Corona robbed, beat and suffocated two men she lured into a motel room. The victims were Marvin Gabriel and Milton Chavez, who were killed in August 2006

• Cathy Sarinana, 42, offense date: Dec. 26, 2005, sentenced: June 26, 2009

Sarinana and her husband, Raul Sarinana, killed their 11-year-old nephew, Ricky Morales, on Christmas 2005. The child was kicked to death after being beaten earlier in the day. They were also accused of killing Ricky's brother.

• Raul Sarinana, 52, offense date: Dec. 26, 2005, sentenced: July 2, 2009

Sarinana and his wife, Cathy, killed their 11-year-old nephew, Ricky Morales, on Christmas 2005. The child was kicked to death after being beaten earlier in the day. They were also accused of killing Ricky's brother.

• David Scott, 48, offense date: Sept. 13, 1992, sentenced: March 19, 1998

Scott was convicted of the murder, rape, and robbery of a woman; the assualt and robbery of a second woman; the burglary and two rapes of a third woman; false imprisonment of a fourth woman; burgalry and two rapes of a fifth woman; robbery of a man; and the attempted murders of two more men.

• Royce Scott, 61, offense date: July 10, 1997, sentenced: Sept. 17, 1997

Scott was convicted of sexually assaulting Della Morris, a Palm Springs woman found dead inside her bedroom. DNA helped identify Scott as a suspect after he was arrested for another burglary.

• Christopher Self, 44, offense date: Oct. 12, 1992, sentenced: Aug. 28, 1996

Self committed a crime spree that involved the deaths of at least three people. His brother, Orlando Romero,, also was involved in the series of events that lasted three months at the end of 1992.

• Jeffrey Sheldon, 56, offense date: Sept. 11, 1983, sentenced: Dec. 19, 1985

Sheldon killed Norris Neblett, 60, during a robbery near Lake Elsinore. He forced Neblett to withdraw money from a bank and the victim was later found dead from strangulation with the rest of his body heavily beaten and bruised.

• Richard Simon, 51, offense date: Dec. 3, 1995, sentenced: Nov. 2, 2001

Simon raped a woman before killing her and her boyfriend. Two months later, he killed another man.

• Janeen Snyder, 39, offense date: April 17, 2001, sentenced: Sept. 7, 2006

Snyder and Michael Thornton were convicted of killing a Las Vegas teenager, Michelle Curran, in Rubidoux. She had been kidnapped and used as a sex slave before being tortured and killed.

• William Suff, 68, offense date: June 28, 1989, sentenced: Oct. 26, 1995

Suff was convicted of killing a dozen women across Riverside County between 1989 and 1991. Most were prostitutes and drug dealers and they were killed via strangulation and stabbing.

• Kesaun Sykes, 31, offense date: Oct. 15, 2008, sentenced: Nov. 7, 2014

Sykes and three Marines killed another Marine and his wife during a French Valley burglary, robbery and rape.The victims were Sgt. Jan Pietrzak and Quiana Jenkins-Pietrzak.

• Justin Thomas, 47, offense date: Sept. 15, 1992, sentenced: March 12, 2008

Thomas killed a man during a drug deal in Moreno Valley.

• James Thompson, 67, offense date: Aug. 28, 1991, sentenced: Oct. 26, 1996

Thompson offered the victim money if he drove him to Canyon Lake to collect a debt, but he instead killed the victim during a robbery.

• Michael Thornton, 63, offense date: April 17, 2001, sentenced: Sept. 7, 2006

Thornton and Janeen Snyder were convicted of killing a Las Vegas teenager, Michelle Curran, in Rubidoux. She had been kidnapped and used as a sex slave before being tortured and killed.

• Javier Victorianne, 42, offense date: July 28, 1999, sentenced: March 28, 2008

Victorianne was accused of killing a 37-year-old woman and a 16-year-old girl one year apart from each other. Investigators said both were killed after refusing sex with Victorianne.

• Jack Williams, 43, offense date: May 19, 1993, sentenced: Aug. 24, 1998

Williams ordered gang members to shoot anyone who resisted car jacking attempts. His conviction involved the death of a mother of two.

• Robertlee Williams, 52, offense date: July 15, 1995, sentenced: Aug. 29, 2003

Williams killed Roscoe Williams and his 28-year-old son, Gary, during a robbery. The victims' throats were slashed.Investigators say Williams was demanding money Gary Williams had stolen during a series of bank robberies.

• Lester Wilson, 53, offense date: June 8, 1997, sentenced: June 29, 2000

Wilson killed Uwe Durbin after the victim stole Wilson's televisions. Wilson confronted Durbin and his family against their will while raping one of the victim's relatives.

• Steve Woodruff, 55, offense date: Jan. 13, 2001, sentenced: April 17, 2003

Woodruff killed a Riverside police officer responding to a complaint about loud music.

• Tony Yonko, 56, offense date: Oct. 22, 2002, sentenced: Sept. 24, 2009

Yonko killed Paul Ngo, 42, during a burglary. He used a hammer in the killing.
